taxMethods.name: VAT
taxMethods.description: Value Added Tax, a consumption tax placed on a product whenever value is added at each stage of the supply chain.

taxMethods.name: GST
taxMethods.description: Goods and Services Tax, a value-added tax levied on most goods and services sold for domestic consumption.

taxMethods.name: Sales Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax on sales or on the receipts from sales.

taxMethods.name: Service Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax levied on services provided.

taxMethods.name: Excise Duty
taxMethods.description: A tax levied on certain goods and commodities produced or sold within a country.

taxMethods.name: Custom Duty
taxMethods.description: A tax levied on imports and exports of goods.

taxMethods.name: Inclusive
taxMethods.description: The tax is included in the price of the product or service.

taxMethods.name: Exclusive
taxMethods.description: The tax is added on top of the price of the product or service.

taxMethods.name: Withholding Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax withheld from employees' wages and paid directly to the government by the employer.

taxMethods.name: Carbon Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax on the carbon content of fuels.

taxMethods.name: Property Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax assessed on real estate by the local government.

taxMethods.name: Luxury Tax
taxMethods.description: A tax on luxury goods, which are considered non-essential.
